title: VC connectivity to BC is flaky
body:
## Description

Setup with Besu, LH BC & LH VC. VC seems to lose connection to BC.

I tried:
- restarting all services
- resyncing BC with checkpoint sync

## Version

`v4.0.2-rc.0`

## Present Behaviour

BC logs don't show anything unusual.

## Expected Behaviour

VC not losing connection to BC every slot.

## Steps to resolve

Unknown.
After a few hours it went back to normal - no more connection issues.

Again after a couple of hours the node got back to throwing lots of these errors.

Another node is also affected. Tried updating to `4.1.0` but having no positive effect. Same flaky errors with connection to BC.

Hey @stefa2k, how's the disk I/O utilisation and CPU utilisation on the VC machine? Does `top` show a high `wa` time here?

```
%Cpu(s):  0.9 us,  0.3 sy,  0.0 ni, 98.6 id,  0.2 wa,  0.0 hi,  0.0 si,  0.0 st
```

This error message suggests that the disk I/O is running slow:

```
CRIT Not signing slashable attestation       error: SQLPoolError("timed out waiting for connection")
```

The beacon node's logs also imply that the node was synced recently, it's possible that things will improve once block backfill finishes, and Besu finishes syncing deposit logs

What does `curl "http://localhost:5052/lighthouse/database/info" | jq` return?

Nodes are offline now, moved the keys away.

IO wait was normal, nothing out of the ordinary. The 2 nodes ran on the same storage cluster, so I'd guess if the first one was having troubles the second one would have as well at the same time, which wasn't the case. They were affected one after the other.

The node synced recently because I tried resyncing with checkpoint sync, which also didn't help.

/E: checked the metrics of the hosts, none of them show any change in io waits whatsoever over the past 7 days.
